snippet.title: Nicktropolis Demo Reel - Nickelodeon Virtual Reality World
snippet.description:
This was from a sizzle reel used by the ad sales group to help explain what Nicktropolis was all about to potential advertisers. The demo reel showed early versions of gameplay, user interactions, chat, and branded areas.

Nickelodeon launched Nicktropolis on January 30, 2007, a completely new kid-targeted multi-media experience that offered visitors the opportunity to engage in a virtual world filled with their favorite web-based activities. At Nicktropolis, kids for the first time had their own virtual community where they had the opportunity to play games, watch videos, explore Nickelodeon-branded and original environments, interact with other kids or Nickelodeon characters in real-time, and create their own personalized rooms.

It was a very unique gaming experience for fans of the many popular Nickelodeon characters and television shows. You could visit Jimmy Neutron or even hang out with your online Nicktropolis friends at Spongebob's Pineapple. It also had a super awesome carnival-like atmosphere by having midway games and carnival rides. 

Some big stats:
Active registered users = 7,000,000
In world gameplays In the first six months = 108,000,000,000
Average time spent = 45 min
Fish created in the aquarium = 500,000

Game technologies include Flash/Flex ActionScript 3, XML, JavaScript and Dynamo.

00:00 Introduction
00:16 Nickself creator
00:28 Decorate your room
00:39 Chat with your friends
00:50 The map
01:10 Visiting show rooms
01:37 Play in world games
02:14 Buy stuff
